channel.title: Introduction :: CC 410 Textbook
channel.description: Resources Slides Video Script In this chapter, weâ€™re going to take a quick detour to discuss parallelism in programming. This will help us better understand the next topic related to GUIs, which is event-driven programming. So, what is parallelism? In short, parallelism involves writing our programs in a way that they can perform multiple tasks simultaneously. We typically do this through the use of threads, contained within the process that our application is running under.
